CVN 1.1

    • Covariate-Varying Networks

Edge Overview

Source: R/find-core-graph.R
cvn_edge_summary.Rd

Function that gives an overview about the number of edges in each subgraph over all fitted CVN models.

Usage

cvn_edge_summary(cvn)

Arguments

cvn

A cvn object

Value

A data.frame.Shows the number of edges in each subgraph, the number of edges present in all graphs (core edges) and the number of edges that are unique for a subgraph

Examples

data(grid)

W <- create_weight_matrix("grid", 3, 3)

# lambdas:
lambda1 = 1  # can also be lambda1 = 1:2 
lambda2 = .2

fit <- CVN(grid, W, lambda1 = lambda1, lambda2 = lambda2)
#> Estimating a CVN with 9 graphs...
#> 
#> Number of cores: 1
#> Uses a warmstart...
#> 
#> -------------------------
#> iteration 1  |  2.180956
#> iteration 2  |  0.115992

cvn_edge_summary(fit)
#>   edges core_edges unique_edges
#> 1    84         34            0
#> 2    86         34            0
#> 3    84         34            0
#> 4    82         34            0
#> 5    84         34            0
